doc.after: The education system of Georgia has undergone sweeping modernizing, although controversial, reforms since 2004.[184][185] Education in Georgia is mandatory for all children aged 6â14.[186] The school system is divided into elementary (six years; age level 6â12), basic (three years; age level 12â15), and secondary (three years; age level 15â18), or alternatively vocational studies (two years). Students with a secondary school certificate have access to higher education. Only the students who have passed the Unified National Examinations may enroll in a state-accredited higher education institution, based on ranking of scores he/she received at the exams.
